### 2. Frequency Adverbs (Negative) - MUST use with negative form

These adverbs require the negative (-ません) form of the verb. They CANNOT be used with positive verbs!
全然雑誌を読みません
vocabulary.en: I don't read magazines at all

vocabulary.reading: 滅多にスポーツをしません

vocabulary.en: 全然わかりません (I don't understand at all)

vocabulary.jp: 滅多に行きません (I rarely go)

vocabulary.en:
---

### 3. Making Suggestions with ～ませんか

To politely suggest something or extend an invitation, use the negative question form:

Pattern: [Verb stem] + ませんか = "Won't you...? / Wouldn't you like to...? / Shall we...?"

Adding emphasis:
- 一緒に (issho ni) = together
- 私と一緒に (watashi to issho ni) = together with me
- どうですか (dou desu ka) = how about...?

#### Examples:

vocabulary.jp: Watashi to issho ni toshokan de benkyou shimasen ka?
vocabulary.reading: Won't you study at the library with me?
